KScriptSetting.Name: response
KScriptSetting.Description: The http response object that is used to set data into http resposne stream
KScriptSetting.Example:
<script engine="kscript">
    var value="value";
	
    k.response.write(value);

    k.response.setHeader("server", "powerful kooboo server");

    k.response.redirect("http://www.kooboo.com");

    var obj = {name: "myname", fieldtwo:"second value"};

    k.response.Json(obj);

    </script>

Method.Name: write
Method.Description: Print the input on output page. If it is not a value type object, it will print Json format of that object.
Method.Example:
<script engine="kscript">

        k.response.write("hello world");
        k.response.write(1234);
        var obj = {name:"myname"};
        k.response.write(obj);

        </script>

Param.Name: value
Param.Description: The object that will be printed

Method.Name: setHeader
Method.Description: set header value on output html page.

Method.Name: execute
Method.Description: Excute another Url, and write the response within current context

Param.Name: Url
Param.Description: The internal relative url starts with /, absolute url starts with http or https

Method.Name: redirect
Method.Description: Redirect user to another url, url can be relative or absolute, status code 302
Method.Example:
<script engine="kscript">

        // relative
        k.response.redirect("/relativepath");

        // absolute
        k.response.redirect("http://www.kooboo.com");
        
        // Default redirect is 302, to make it 301 redirect, add below line.
        k.response.statusCode(301); 

        </script>

Method.Name: json
Method.Description: Print the object in Json format, if the object is a value type like string, or number, it will print the string format of that value.
